entry.title: Montana’s Controversial Bill to Eliminate Adult-Use Marijuana Dispensaries
entry.summary: Montana, which legalized recreational marijuana in November 2020, has experienced a booming cannabis industry, with sales reaching $203 million in its first year. However, the introduction of Senate Bill 546 by Sen. Keith Regier, R-Kalispell, has sparked debate as it aims to eliminate adult-use dispensaries and significantly alter Montana’s marijuana marketplace. Understanding Senate Bill 546 [...]

entry.title: Delaware Joins the Ranks as the 22nd State to Legalize Recreational Marijuana
entry.summary: Delaware legalizes recreational marijuana, becoming the 22nd state to do so. The state's new laws allow for personal possession and a regulated adult-use market. The industry is expected to bring in tens of millions of dollars in tax revenue, and the state aims to promote restorative justice and reduce the prison population.
